elements.text: [Part Four]
Running from the sound.
No, not yet. You'll not take me yet.
Pursue, pursue. I must have him. I must.
What's going on? Ah! No! No, I will not submit.
Quickly. Quickly, man. Your hand. Up onto my horse.
Effort.
Away. Let's away
Thank you.
Pouring liquid.

Now where can that girl have got to? A fellow having to pour his own wine? (tuts) Mmm, yes, not a bad drop. A horseman? It's like before. The spirits, they have returned. 'Od's fish, what if they've come for me?
Regular beeping over hoofbeats.
What is that sound?
I don't know. Wait a minute. In my coat.
What is that?
The playing card Valentine gave me. Some sort of homing device.
A homing? Then you must destroy it.
It's quite sophisticated. I'm afraid I haven't. (horse stops) This is Holywell's house. How did you know
Dismounts.
Never mind, my friend. They're gaining on you. Farewell.
Wait!
Lovemore gallops off.
Doctor, are you all right?
No, not yet.
It is happening again.
Yes, drawn here by this playing card.
What?
Valentine's calling in his debts. Quickly, Samuel, I must destroy the card. Won't tear. Samuel, your fire.
Alas, Doctor, there is none made. Hannah has vanished. Quickly, Doctor, it's almost here. Look. Look. Do you see them? Great God, Doctor. The phantoms! I can see them.
Just psychic manifestations of a controlling force. Never mind them, Samuel. Have you a match?
Surely.
Strikes a match. Dialogue partially obscured by sound effect.
Their faces. Do you see their faces? Ghastly pale, their eyes like black coal.
The missing gentlemen, Samuel, in the flesh. There!
It's catching.
Sound fizzles out.
Well, that's the end of that, for now. I don't know about you, but I could murder a cup of tea.
Voices cry out.
What? What is this?
You're bested, Valentine. Your prey has outwitted you.
Impossible. Oh, this Doctor intrigues me. A mind such as his would not be merely one more clot of jelly to add to my pyre. Perhaps his could be the final organising intelligence!
What do you say, villain?
Silence! I must assess the state of the machines. Prepare them. Bait my trap with honey for the Doctor.
There, you can just see the remains of the circuitry.
And this is how Valentine captures these people?
Apparently.
Doctor, I am at a loss to understand.
The playing card acts as some kind of beacon.
Attracting the spirits?
They're not spirits, Samuel. They're the collective unconsciousness of the men Valentine kidnapped.
I see. Er, no, I do not see.

Well, Valentine's using their minds to reach out and attack others. The playing card he gives to everyone he gambles with has a kind of beacon inside. It draws those things we saw outside like wasps to a jam-jar. I think each card carries the intended victim's biodata. As soon as they touch the card, the information must be absorbed and downloaded.
You mean, by their mere touch they are bound to him?
Yes. Which is why Valentine always wears gloves.
Oh, this runs deeper than we feared, my friend. But Doctor, what of Edmund Carteret, whom we saw attacked out there in the street?
I suspect his heart gave out through sheer terror, rendering him useless to Valentine's cause.
What is his cause, Doctor? What could the fiend be about?
Well, that's something we have to find out. First though.
What have you there? Another playing card? Why, it's the one you prised from the hand of the dead man.
The same. I just want to try a little experiment. Hold the card, would you, Samuel? Here, take this handkerchief. Now, if I can set up a neutralising wave with this little gadget.
Low hum.
Oh, ah, it's getting hot, Doctor.
Just keep hold of it.
It's turning blue!
Yes, I'm erasing Edmund Carteret's bioprint from the circuitry.
Hum stops.

Ah, there we are. Good as new. Now give it back to me, Samuel. Careful, don't touch it without the handkerchief. We must keep this wrapped up. There. Safe and sound inside Wisdens. You never know when it might come in handy.
Door opens.
Hannah!
Oh, sir, sir.
Quick, she's fainted.
(Rustling leaves. Whispering. Occasional owl hooting, probably a long eared one.)
So, here is the tiger's lair, eh, Master Turlough?
Yes, looks like it.
An ordinary enough house for one who consorts with demons.
Well, he's hardly going to advertise it, is he? There's something odd about the atmosphere. Can't you feel it? A charge, like before a thunderstorm.
There, look you. The attic room is aglow.
Then that's where we're going. Come on.
But where have you been, Hannah? We searched all through the house. Oh, here, drink this.
I was a-hiding, sir. I heard the phantoms coming and was afraid for my very soul.
Really.
Aye, sir. Do you doubt me?
Doctor?
It's just that your boots tell a different story.
What is this?
Were you really hiding? Or were you very gallantly rescuing me?
The horseman?
Alias Major Billy Lovemore.
Most wanted man in London? Well, you have me there. I forgot about the boots. The one part of demure little Hannah that I've not put back on.
What is the meaning of this?
Samuel, I think we've all rather underestimated your maid.
I do not follow.
I'm afraid all the time we've been worrying about sheltering her from this dangerous business, she's been living a double life.
By day my housekeeper.
And by night marauding the highways, swashing her buckle, and knocking heads together. Domestic violence, you might say.
Hannah, what is he saying?
It's true, Doctor Holywell. Every word. I'm the fellow they've all been after, and I've run 'em ragged from Temple Bar to Cripplegate.
You have disguised yourself as this footpad? For what purpose?

Because I could. Because all that is expected of my sex is demureness, or silliness, or a life of slavery in the kitchens. But I showed them, showed all those curs like Ned Cotton, who thought they had me just where they wanted me.

Ahem. Isn't there a little more to it than that? You showed very little surprise when I told you I had a homing device in my pocket. I imagine such things are common on your world, just like the device you used to disguise your voice.
On her world?
The man we seek is Carthok of Daodalus.
What are you saying?

He is the worst of men, a killer, a monster, but that scarcely does justice to the magnitude of his crimes. He is deranged, a black-hearted psychopath, but he is clever. He escaped execution and for years we have scoured the galaxies in search of him. Some time ago, we picked up a faint trace of his bioprint on this planet.
And you were sent to find him.
No, not sent. I chose to come. I hired a privateer to bring me to Earth.
Why are you so concerned that he's captured?
Because, Doctor, amongst the dozens he has slaughtered were my mother and father. I swore I would avenge them, and now my chance has finally arrived.
Am I to understand that my little Hannah is not merely a highwayman, but a being from another world?
I am sorry to have so misled you, Samuel. When I arrived on Earth, I became Hannah Fry in order to observe discreetly and find my enemy.
And then you became Lovemore.
Because he could go places no mere woman could on this backwards planet. Oh yes, the Major's been very useful to me.
Well, now that's all sorted, I suggest we get on. If Valentine's our man, let's beard him in his den.
But where is he?
Hang on a minute. Where's Turlough?
Quickly, Jasper.
Nearly (pause) there.
Glass breaking.
Ah.
Well done. Now, let's get inside.
Oh, I've lost the shape for this activity, my friend.
Come on. I want to find out what's going on here, because whatever it is, I've a feeling it's distinctly out of place in the year 1702. What is this place?
Oh, the stench, as of rotted flesh.
You may be close to the truth, Jasper. Look at the walls, red, livid, like raw meat.
I must give this fellow Valentine the name of me decorator.
Ah, the stairs. Come along, Jasper. Follow me.
[OC]: Up there, a door. Do you see it?
Well, my friends, we have visitors, it seems.
Ah, it's like a slaughterhouse in here.
Don't think about it, Jasper. Are you armed?
Aye.
Here's the door. Ready?
Ready as I'll ever be.
Door opened.
Hold, villain. Your machinations are ended.
Valentine laughs.
Great God. Look at them. Look at them.
What have you done to these men, Valentine?
Gentlemen, so glad you could come. How kind of you to be here for the end of our little drama. But I think a little audience participation is required, don't you?
Don't stir, maggot. I'm armed.
Insect!
Energy weapon. Pistol falls.
Away with that primitive weapon.
It's melted! My pistol's melted like lead!
I have taken precautions to prevent unwanted accidents here in this chamber. It would not do for it to be damaged. It is the very heart of my enterprise.
Whoa, boy.
Are you sure this is the house?
I dragged that man Poltrot from his bed. He gave us the address on pain of a kick up the rear.
This is the house. You see? Up there, in the attic room.
It blazes like a light show.
I have a feeling Valentine is approaching his end game.
What now?
Samuel, I want you to break in somehow. Try a window round the back.
What about you?
I think boldness is our best bet.
You mean you're just going to knock on the front door?
What a splendid idea.
There, my boy. You're secured.
What is this contraption you've put about me, Valentine? It cuts into me skin. Ah!
Let him go, Valentine.
Fear not, my friend. Your suffering will be short-lived, and then this gentleman will be processed also.
Please don't hurry on my account.
You mean to make me like these others, a mere husk.
It will probably not come to that. I suspect your intellectual capacity to be rather limited.
Oh, and mass slaughter and murder is a sign of high intellect, is it?
Your brains will burn out before long. Ah, the party is complete. If you will excuse me.
'Od's my life, Master Turlough, we're done for.
We're not dead yet, Jasper. Wait a minute. Isn't that your friend, Flowers?
What? Yonder, yes, yes, it's Flowers. Quincy! Quincy, can you hear me?
Jeake? Is that you?
Yes. Yes, my friend. We came to rescue you.
Oh, thank God!
But, er, we didn't do very well.
Then it is doom, doom for all of us. Valentine is playing his final game.
Game? If he thinks this torture chamber is a game, he must be some sort of psychopath.
What's it all for?
For us, I'm afraid. It is the ultimate game.
What do you mean? What's at stake?
The whole world.
Knocking on door. Door opened.
Hello. I've come to read the meter.
Doctor. What an entirely expected pleasure.
Hmm. But you were expecting me a little earlier, weren't you?
(laughs) Come in, come in, you and your charming friend.
Door closed.
As you can see, Miss Fry here is armed. It would be most unwise of you to try anything.
The very idea.
Keep him covered, Hannah.
Yes, Doctor.
Pistol cocked.
That's quite a light show you've got going on upstairs. Must cost a fortune.
It costs some a fortune.
Oh, I'm sure. They pay with their reason, with their lives.
You're very well informed.
Oh, yes, I know all about you.
You know nothing about me!
Really? Carthok of Daodalus.
It's been a long time since I've heard that name. Oh, if you only knew how long. The endless empty years, waiting, waiting.
Waiting for what?
To escape the narrow confines of this world, to split asunder
the coffin of my existence and once more tread among the stars.
That's a very pretty speech.

My home is many light years from this little blue world, but I've blended in rather well, don't you think? Who would know that Sir Nikolas Valentine, who has the ear of the Crowned Heads of Europe, was once Carthok, slaughterer of the unworthy.
I would.
What say you, girl?
Slaughterer of the unworthy.
How come you to know me?
I came here to find you, monster, and to put an end to your wretched life.
Valentine laughs.
I am armed.
So you are, my dear. Tell me, is this a personal mission, or is it my reputation you envy?
You murdered my parents, you unspeakable fiend.
Did I? Did I? How remiss of me. I suppose a formal apology wouldn't do any good?
All right, Valentine, show me your ship. It's time I put an end to your amusements.
Move.
I think the rope's loosening, Jasper.
Ah, this device cuts into me head like cheesewire.
Then keep still and look to your friend Flowers.
He don't look so hot.
Keep him talking.
Flowers! Flowers, you rogue. Are you still will us?
I'm done for, my friend.
Never. Just think of getting a crack at that blackguard Valentine.
Yes, you'll soon sort him out.
Shh. He comes.
Door opens.
Doctor!
Don't worry, Turlough. Everything's going to be all right.
Ever the optimist.
I found this planet a squalid, muddy hole.
But you stayed.
I had no choice. My ship was almost destroyed in my haste to escape. As you can see, it is biomechanical. I knew it would take time to regenerate its fabric.
Great God, Doctor. Free us. Free us from this chamber of the damned.
Yes, would that be too much to ask?
Hannah, would you mind?
Of course, Doctor.
Thank you, Hannah. And how precisely have you been regenerating the fabric of your ship, Valentine?
Like the cells of a gigantic brain.
Precisely. I kept my ship alive, repairing itself little by little.
And emerging occasionally every thirty years?
Always I was able to inveigle my way into society, to make the contacts I needed to find the, the stimulus my ship requires.
Stimulus? Oh, I see.
It's disgusting.
The liveliest, keenest minds available. Through my gaming, I found it easy to procure the men I needed. Those whose minds could withstand the strain involved in bringing my ship back from the grave!

But the game is over, Valentine. Shut down the systems. I will make you pay for the innocents you've slaughtered on our world, and those whose poor lives are extinguished here, they shall have their revenge. I am taking you back to Daoladus.
(long evil laugh) You think I will follow you, meek as a lamb, after all these years of waiting?
You have no choice.
Ah, but I do, Doctor.
Doctor, look out! He's got this place rigged for self-defence.
Energy weapon, Hannah cries out.
Back! Back, all of you.
Hannah, are you all right?
Hannah is gasping.
My ship will depart, Doctor, and destroy this festering city in the process.
There's no need for that.

Isn't there? Deep within these living walls are the bones of the many who have aided me throughout the years. They stand as a marker to the wasted hours of my once glorious existence. I have given everything to see my ship fly again, and use it to rain down terror on my enemies.
I can't let you do that.

This time I hold all the aces, Doctor. I have watched this cess pool they call London grow around my ship. I shall take pleasure in seeing its destruction. I need but one more boost for my ship to be fully operational. One more mind.
Oh, no.
I favoured you, naturally, my dear Doctor, but I think it would have a certain piquancy if the young lady were to act as a substitute.
You've no quarrel with her, Valentine. Take me!
The hunter becomes the hunted. I like that. You two, put her in the machine.
Do it yourself. You're the one with the taste for torture.
I advise you to do as I say, or the next blast will take your prattling head clean off those boyish shoulders.
Er, Turlough.
Well, since he puts it like that.
Ah, voices. Valentine has the Doctor. Oh, I must be swift and silent.
Hannah cries out.
I'm sorry, Hannah. Don't worry
Cease your chattering, boy.
Connections completed.
Splendid. Now, girl, give up your mind to me. Breathe life into my starship. My harvest is complete.
Don't listen to him, Hannah. You must fight him! Fight him!
Doctor, I cannot bear this pain.
Fight him, Hannah. Think what he did to your family, your people. You came here to find him. You must defeat him.
Beginning final sequence.
Valentine, this is senseless!
She will submit, Doctor. I will possess her mind. She will sound the clarion call of my revenge.
Hannah screams. The door opens as energy builds up.
No! Get away from her, you cur!
(laughs) You're too late. The game is over.
No, not quite.
Doctor, we have to get her out of there.
I know. There's something I have that will give you unimaginable power.
Valentine laughs.
I offer it in exchange for the girl's life.
Oh no, I have no time for trickery.
Turlough, you must get the Wisdens away from here.
What?
The Wisdens. At least get that away from here. Destroy the Wisden's Almanack. Its power is incalculable.
What gabbling is this? Have you lost your reason, Doctor?
The Wisdens? What do you mean?
Ah, I think I know. Hang on, Doctor.
Energy weapon.
Get back. Now, Doctor.
Yes?
Please, this object to which you speak.
I told you. In exchange for the girl's life. Now let her go.
You think to defy me? I shall have the coat from your back!
Brief struggle.
What relics are these? A red ball, string. Where is this power of which you boast? Ah.
No, put it down, I implore you.
(turns pages) Wisden's Almanack? Why, it's a mere book. How could you hope to fool me with. What's this? The card! It is Carteret's playing card.
Yes. And you've touched it, Valentine. You've touched it with your bare hands.
Beeping.
Now it's downloading your biodata.
What is that to me? Prepare for departure!
It means a great deal to you, Valentine. You've made yourself vulnerable at last.
(laughs) Ha! Vulnerable? Vulnerable to what? To these lifeless husks? Their work is done.
I don't think so. Turlough, get Flowers and Hannah out of there.
You would not dare defy me.
Come on, Hannah.
No, leave me. These poor wretches have not the strength.
Don't be stupid. You must
No, Hannah. I can't allow this.
Please, this is not your problem. I came here seeking vengeance, and I shall have it at last.
No, wait.
Listen to me, all of you. All of you who've laboured here for Valentine. You have his, his biodata. Just like the others, pursue him. Seek him out.
What is she doing?
Turning his own torture chamber against him.
Feel his being in your minds. Feel it.
No!
Revenge yourselves upon him, the architect of your pain.
No! No!
Doctor, we've got to do something.
Hannah!
Now, attack! Attack Valentine! Let your energy flow through him!
No!
The noise fills the room.
What is happening to him?
His skin. Look at his skin!
It's horrible.
Quickly, Turlough. Get her out of that thing.
Hannah. (electric sizzle) I can't. The whole thing's burning with raw energy. Hannah!
Hannah screams.
Doctor!
I'm afraid she's gone. The (unintelligible) was too much for her.
Oh, Hannah.
Is it finished, Doctor?
Far from it. It's too late to help these others, but I must stop this ship from leaving. You go.
We can't leave without you.
Go!
Come, my friends. Let's away from this hell hole.
I'm not leaving, Doctor.
What?
Well, it wouldn't be cricket, would it?
Oh, all right. All right. Make yourself useful. Help me to key in an overload sequence.
Running.
What of that Doctor fellow?
Yes, we must wait for him.
And Master Turlough.
Wait, here they are!
Get down! Down!
Get down!
KaBOOM! Fireworks sounds.
Street sellers cries.
Oh, my poor Hannah.
Yes, I should have been able to save her.
She knew what she was up against, Doctor. She was on a mission.
And it was successful. Carthok of Daodalus is no more.
And London is safe, Doctor, thanks to you.
Well, well, quite an adventure, Doctor. Where next for you and Master Turlough?
Ah, well, that's just the point, you see. We never can tell.
How awful for you.
Not really. It's half the fun.
And what of you, gentlemen?
Well, we would be honoured to enrol Doctor Holywell here in the Diabola Club.
I have to admit, I did put in a good word for you, Doctor Holywell.
What say you, Samuel?
Well, I er
If I were you, I'd stick to snap in the future.
